intro: Rhipidoglossum densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflowered rhipidoglossum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its clustered, small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. It is a relatively rare species, found primarily in specific regions of southern Africa.
